verses.verse: A <S%H4210>Psalm<s%> and <S%H7892>Song<s%> at the <S%H2598>dedication<s%> of the <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H1732>David.<s%> I will <S%H7311>extol<s%> thee, O <S%H3068>LORD;<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> thou hast lifted me <S%H1802>up,<s%> and hast <S%H3808>not<s%> made my <S%H341>foes<s%> to <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> over me.
O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> my <S%H430>God,<s%> I <S%H7768>cried<s%> <S%H413>unto<s%> thee, and thou hast <S%H7495>healed<s%> me.

O <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> thou hast brought <S%H5927>up<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> the <S%H7585>grave:<s%> thou hast kept me <S%H2421>alive,<s%> that I should not go <S%H4480>down<s%> <S%H3381><s%> to the <S%H953>pit.<s%>
Sing <S%H2167><s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> O ye <S%H2623>saints<s%> of his, and give <S%H3034>thanks<s%> at the <S%H2143>remembrance<s%> of his <S%H6944>holiness.<s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> his <S%H639>anger<s%> endureth but a <S%H7281>moment;<s%> in his <S%H7522>favor<s%> is <S%H2416>life:<s%> <S%H1065>weeping<s%> may <S%H3885>endure<s%> for a <S%H6153>night,<s%> but <S%H7440>joy<s%> cometh in the <S%H1242>morning.<s%>
And in my <S%H7959>prosperity<s%> <S%H589>I<s%> <S%H559>said,<s%> I shall <S%H1077>never<s%> <S%H5769><s%> be <S%H4131>moved.<s%>

LORD, <S%H3068><s%> by thy <S%H7522>favor<s%> thou hast made my <S%H2042>mountain<s%> to <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H5797>strong:<s%> thou didst <S%H5641>hide<s%> thy <S%H6440>face,<s%> and I <S%H1961>was<s%> <S%H926>troubled.<s%>
I <S%H7121>cried<s%> <S%H413>to<s%> thee, O <S%H3068>LORD;<s%> and <S%H413>unto<s%> the <S%H136>LORD<s%> I made <S%H2603>supplication.<s%>

What <S%H4100><s%> <S%H1215>profit<s%> is there in my <S%H1818>blood,<s%> when I go <S%H3381>down<s%> <S%H413>to<s%> the <S%H7845>pit?<s%> Shall the <S%H6083>dust<s%> <S%H3034>praise<s%> thee? shall it <S%H5046>declare<s%> thy <S%H571>truth?<s%>
Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> and have <S%H2603>mercy<s%> upon me: <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> <S%H1961>be<s%> thou my <S%H5826>helper.<s%>

Thou hast <S%H2015>turned<s%> for me my <S%H4553>mourning<s%> into <S%H4234>dancing:<s%> thou hast put <S%H6605>off<s%> my <S%H8242>sackcloth,<s%> and <S%H247>girded<s%> me with <S%H8057>gladness;<s%>

To the end <S%H4616>that<s%> my <S%H3519>glory<s%> may sing <S%H2167>praise<s%> to thee, and <S%H3808>not<s%> be <S%H1826>silent.<s%> O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> my <S%H430>God,<s%> I will give <S%H3034>thanks<s%> unto thee <S%H5769>forever.<s%>
